option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"/Users/macbookpro/AndroidStudioProjects/projectakhirpamterapan":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/components/EventCardWithQr.kt\":\"This file contains Compose UI components and utility functions for a campus event management application.\\n\\n`EventCard`: A composable function that displays an event card with details such as title, date, time, location, and participant count.\\n\\n`QrInviteDialog`: A composable function that displays a dialog with a QR code for the event and provides a button to download the QR code.\\n\\n`generateQrBitmap`: A function that generates a QR code bitmap from a given text.\\n\\n`saveBitmapToGallery`: A suspend function that saves a bitmap image to the device\\u0027s gallery.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file is the main entry point for the Android application and sets up the navigation and screens for the app.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity that sets up the app\\u0027s UI and navigation.\\n\\n`onCreate`: Initializes the app\\u0027s UI and navigation, including setting up the dark theme, status bar, and navigation bar colors.\\n\\n`LoginScreen`: Displays the login screen and handles login functionality.\\n\\n`RegisterScreen`: Displays the registration screen and handles registration functionality.\\n\\n`RoleSelectionScreen`: Allows the user to select their role (participant or organizer) after logging in.\\n\\n`PesertaDashboardScreen`: Displays the dashboard for participants, including a list of events.\\n\\n`PesertaDashboardViewModel`: Manages the state and logic for the participant dashboard.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardScreen`: Displays the dashboard for organizers, including a list of events they have created.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardViewModel`: Manages the state and logic for the organizer dashboard.\\n\\n`CreateEventScreen`: Allows organizers to create new events.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/PanitiaDashboardScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a Composable function `PanitiaDashboardScreen` that renders the dashboard screen for a panitia (committee) in an Android app. The file also includes several other Composable functions that are used within the `PanitiaDashboardScreen` function.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardScreen`: Renders the dashboard screen for a panitia, including a list of events, a search and filter functionality, and a floating action button to create a new event.\\n\\n`HeroSection`: Displays a hero section with the user\\u0027s name and some information about the dashboard.\\n\\n`FilterAndSearchRow`: Renders a row with filter options and a search input.\\n\\n`EventCard`: Displays a card for an individual event, including its title, location, and status.\\n\\n`EventSkeletonCard`: Displays a skeleton card for an event while the data is being loaded.\\n\\n`EmptyStateCard`: Displays a card with an empty state message when there are no events to display.\\n\\n`QrInviteDialog`: Displays a dialog with a QR code for an event.\\n\\n`VerticalScrollbar`: Renders a vertical scrollbar for the event list.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/theme/Type.kt\":\"This file defines the typography styles for a Jetpack Compose-based Android application. It sets the default text style for the `bodyLarge` component, and provides commented-out examples for other text styles such as `titleLarge` and `labelSmall`.\\n\\n`Typography`: Defines the set of Material typography styles to be used in the application.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the app\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/components/PanitiaHeroAndFilter.kt\":\"This file contains Composable functions for a Panitia (Committee) dashboard UI in an Android app built with Jetpack Compose.\\n\\n`HeroSection`: Displays a card with user information, event statistics, and a calendar-like icon.\\n\\n`MiniStat`: Displays a mini statistic card with a label and value.\\n\\n`FilterAndSearchRow`: Provides a row with filter chips and a search input field.\\n\\n`FilterChip`: Displays a customizable filter chip with a selected state.\\n\\nThis file defines the UI components for the Panitia dashboard, including a hero section with user information and event statistics, as well as a filter and search functionality to manage events.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/auth/RegisterScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a single Composable function:\\n\\n`RegisterScreen`: This function creates a registration screen for an app, allowing users to enter their name, email, password, and confirm password, and handles the registration process.\\n\\nThe file also imports various Compose UI components and handles the state of the registration process, including displaying error messages and navigating to the login screen upon successful registration.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/QrInvitation.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`QrInvitation`: A data class that represents a QR code invitation for an event, containing the event ID and the QR code string.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a data class to represent the structure of a QR code invitation for an event.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/User.kt\":\"This file contains several data classes that define the structure of user-related data and responses in a project.\\n\\n`User`: A data class that represents a user with an ID, name, email, and role.\\n\\n`LoginRequest`: A data class that represents a request for user login, containing an email and password.\\n\\n`RegisterRequest`: A data class that represents a request for user registration, containing a name, email, password, and a default role of \\\"peserta\\\".\\n\\n`LoginResponse`: A data class that represents the response to a login request, containing a success flag, a message, an optional token, and an optional user object.\\n\\n`BasicResponse`: A data class that represents a basic response, containing a success flag, a message, and an optional user object.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/JoinByQrRequest.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`JoinByQrRequest`: A data class that represents a request to join a group or event using a QR code.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It simply defines a data class that holds a single property, `qr_code`, which is a string representing the QR code used to join a group or event.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/data/remote/ApiService.kt\":\"This file defines an `ApiService` interface that provides methods for interacting with a remote API. The interface includes the following functions:\\n\\n`login`: Logs in a user with the provided `LoginRequest` and returns a `LoginResponse`.\\n`register`: Registers a new user with the provided `RegisterRequest` and returns a `BasicResponse`.\\n`getPanitiaEvents`: Retrieves a list of events created by the user with the provided `createdByUserId` and returns an `EventsResponse`.\\n`createEvent`: Creates a new event with the provided `CreateEventRequest` and returns an `Event`.\\n`getQrInvitation`: Retrieves the QR invitation for the event with the provided `eventId` and returns a `QrInvitationResponse`.\\n`deleteQrInvitation`: Deletes the QR invitation for the event with the provided `eventId` and returns a `BasicResponse`.\\n`getPesertaEvents`: Retrieves a list of events that the user with the provided `userId` has joined and returns an `EventsResponse`.\\n`joinEventByQr`: Joins an event using the provided `JoinByQrRequest` and returns a `JoinEventResponse`.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/data/EventRepository.kt\":\"This file contains the `EventRepository` class and several functions related to event management and QR code invitation handling.\\n\\n`EventRepository`: A repository class that handles event-related operations, including fetching events for organizers and participants, creating new events, and managing QR code invitations.\\n\\n`handleEventsResponse`: A helper function that processes the response from the API and returns a `Result` object containing the list of events or an exception.\\n\\n`getPanitiaEvents`: Fetches the list of events created by the user with the specified ID.\\n\\n`createEvent`: Creates a new event with the provided request data.\\n\\n`getQrInvitation`: Retrieves the QR code invitation for the specified event.\\n\\n`deleteQrInvitation`: Deletes the QR code invitation for the specified event.\\n\\n`getPesertaEvents`: Fetches the list of events that the user with the specified ID is participating in.\\n\\n`joinEventByQr`: Allows a user to join an event by providing the QR code.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/PanitiaDashboardViewModel.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of a ViewModel and a ViewModelFactory for a Panitia (committee) dashboard in an Android application.\\n\\n`EventFilter`: An enum class that represents the different filters for events (All, Upcoming, Ongoing, Done).\\n\\n`EventUiModel`: A data class that represents the UI model for an event, containing information such as title, date, time, location, status, participants, and QR code.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardUiState`: A data class that represents the UI state of the Panitia dashboard, including loading state, event list, filter, search query, and error message.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardViewModel`: A ViewModel class that manages the state of the Panitia dashboard, including fetching events, applying filters and search, and updating the UI state.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardViewModelFactory`: A ViewModelProvider.Factory class that creates instances of the `PanitiaDashboardViewModel` with the required dependencies.\\n\\n`toUiModel()`: A function that maps the backend `Event` model to the `EventUiModel` used in the UI.\\n\\n`refresh()`: A function that fetches the latest events from the repository and updates the UI state.\\n\\n`startPolling()`: A function that periodically refreshes the event data without showing the loading state.\\n\\n`onFilterSelected()`: A function that updates the UI state with the selected event filter.\\n\\n`onSearchQueryChange()`: A function that updates the UI state with the search query.\\n\\n`applyFilterAndSearch()`: A function that applies the selected filter and search query to the event list and updates the UI state.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the project\\u0027s dependency management and plugin management settings.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins.\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving project dependencies.\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project.\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the `:app` module in the project.\\n\\nThis file ensures that the project\\u0027s dependencies and plugins are properly managed and resolved, allowing the project to be built and run correctly.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/auth/LoginScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a single Composable function:\\n\\n`LoginScreen`: This function creates a login screen UI using Jetpack Compose, allowing users to enter their email and password, and providing functionality to log in, register, and handle error messages.\\n\\nThe file as a whole implements the login screen for an event campus application, handling user authentication and navigation to the registration screen.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, dependencies, and build settings for the application. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the project using the Gradle DSL (Domain-Specific Language) to specify the Android application plugin, Kotlin support, Compose UI framework, and various dependencies such as Android KTX, Compose, Material 3, Navigation Compose, ViewModel, Retrofit, and OkHttp.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/PanitiaNavGraph.kt\":\"This file defines the navigation graph for the Panitia (Committee) section of the application. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`PanitiaRoutes`: Defines the routes for the Panitia navigation graph, including the Dashboard and Create Event screens.\\n\\n`PanitiaNavGraph`: Defines the navigation graph for the Panitia section, including the Dashboard and Create Event screens. It takes in an `EventRepository`, `authToken`, `createdByUserId`, and `userName` as parameters.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardViewModelFactory`: Provides a custom factory for creating the `PanitiaDashboardViewModel` instance, which is used in the `PanitiaDashboardScreen`.\\n\\n`PanitiaDashboardScreen`: Displays the Panitia Dashboard screen, which includes a list of events and a button to navigate to the Create Event screen.\\n\\n`CreateEventScreen`: Displays the Create Event screen, which allows the user to create a new event. It takes in the `EventRepository`, `authToken`, and `createdByUserId` as parameters, and provides callbacks for navigating back and handling successful event creation.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/theme/Theme.kt\":\"This file defines the theme for the \\\"ProjectakhirpamterapanTheme\\\" application, which includes light and dark color schemes, as well as the typography used throughout the application.\\n\\n`LightColorScheme`: Defines the light color scheme for the application.\\n\\n`DarkColorScheme`: Defines the dark color scheme for the application.\\n\\n`ProjectakhirpamterapanTheme`: Provides a composable function that sets the color scheme and typography for the application based on the user\\u0027s preference for a light or dark theme.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/data/remote/ApiConfig.kt\":\"This file defines the configuration for the API service used in the project.\\n\\n`ApiConfig`: This object provides a way to configure and create an instance of the `ApiService` interface.\\n\\n`getApiService()`: This function creates an instance of the `ApiService` interface by setting up the necessary Retrofit configuration, including the base URL, Gson converter, and an OkHttpClient with a logging interceptor.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/Event.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`Event`: A data class that represents an event, with properties such as the event\\u0027s ID, creator, title, date, time, location, status, number of participants, and an optional QR code.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It serves as a model class to represent the structure of an event in the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/CreateEventScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a Composable function `CreateEventScreen` that allows users to create an event with details such as title, date, time, and location. It also includes custom components `CustomOutlinedTextField` and `StatusChipReadOnly`, as well as helper functions `formatIndonesianDateForm` and `formatIndonesianTimeForm` for formatting date and time values.\\n\\n`CreateEventScreen`: Composable function that creates a screen for users to input event details and submit the event.\\n\\n`CustomOutlinedTextField`: Composable function that creates a custom outlined text field with a leading icon and optional click functionality.\\n\\n`StatusChipReadOnly`: Composable function that creates a read-only status chip with customizable colors and text.\\n\\n`formatIndonesianDateForm`: Helper function that formats a date string in the format \\\"dd MMM yyyy\\\".\\n\\n`formatIndonesianTimeForm`: Helper function that formats a time string in the format \\\"HH:mm WIB\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/role/RoleSelectionScreen.kt\":\"This file contains a Compose-based UI for a role selection screen in an event management application.\\n\\n`RoleSelectionScreen`: A composable function that displays a screen with two cards, one for \\\"Peserta\\\" (Participant) and one for \\\"Panitia\\\" (Organizer), allowing the user to select their role.\\n\\n`RoleCardEqualHeight`: A composable function that creates a card with a specific design and content, used within the `RoleSelectionScreen`.\\n\\nThe file defines the layout, styling, and functionality of the role selection screen, allowing users to choose between the \\\"Peserta\\\" and \\\"Panitia\\\" roles, which will likely affect the features and permissions available to them within the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/data/AuthRepository.kt\":\"This file contains the `AuthRepository` class and several functions within it.\\n\\n`AuthRepository`: This class is responsible for handling authentication-related operations, such as login and registration.\\n\\n`login`: This function attempts to log in a user with the provided email and password, and returns the login response or an error if the login fails.\\n\\n`register`: This function attempts to register a new user with the provided name, email, and password, and returns the registration response or an error if the registration fails.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/components/DateTimeFormatters.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`formatIndonesianDate`: This function takes a raw date string and formats it into a human-readable Indonesian date format.\\n\\n`formatIndonesianTime`: This function takes a raw time string and formats it into a human-readable Indonesian time format.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide utility functions for formatting date and time strings into a localized Indonesian format.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/theme/Color.kt\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a set of color values for a light and dark theme in a Compose-based Android application. The colors are defined using the `Color` class from the Compose UI library and are organized into different categories such as primary, secondary, background, and surface colors. This file serves as a centralized location for managing the color scheme of the application, allowing for easy customization and consistency across the UI.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/EventsResponse.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`EventsResponse`: A data class that represents the response from an API call, containing information about the success of the request, a message, and a list of `Event` objects.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It serves as a data model for the `EventsResponse` object, which can be used to parse and store the response data from an API call related to events.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/panitia/components/PanitiaCommonComponents.kt\":\"This file contains several Composable functions that are used to create UI components for a Panitia (committee) screen in an Android app.\\n\\n`ErrorBanner`: A card-like component that displays an error message and a \\\"Retry\\\" button.\\n\\n`VerticalScrollbar`: A custom vertical scrollbar that is integrated with a LazyListState to provide a scrolling experience.\\n\\n`EventSkeletonCard`: A skeleton loading card that simulates a loading state for an event item.\\n\\n`EmptyStateCard`: A card-like component that displays a message when there are no events to display.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides reusable UI components that can be used in the Panitia screen of the Android app.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but instead, it sets up the necessary plugins for the project, including the Android application plugin, the Kotlin Android plugin, and the Kotlin Compose plugin.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a centralized location for defining common build settings and dependencies that can be shared across all the sub-projects or modules in the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ui/auth/AuthViewModel.kt\":\"This file contains the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`LoginUiState`: A data class that represents the state of the login UI.\\n\\n`AuthViewModel`: An Android ViewModel that handles the authentication logic, including login and registration.\\n\\n`login(email: String, password: String)`: Logs in the user with the provided email and password.\\n\\n`register(name: String, email: String, password: String)`: Registers a new user with the provided name, email, and password.\\n\\n`clearError()`: Clears the error message in the login state.\\n\\n`clearRegisterFlag()`: Clears the register success flag in the login state.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for the authentication-related functionality in the Android application, including handling user login and registration.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/model/CreateEventRequest.kt\":\"This file contains a single data class:\\n\\n`CreateEventRequest`: A data class that represents a request to create an event, with fields for the event\\u0027s creator, title, date, time, location, and status.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It serves as a model for the data structure used in creating an event.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/projectakhirpamterapan/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that verifies the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test case to verify the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 results in 4, which is the expected outcome.\"}"}
